page.title: 19CHANGING TIMES IN STOURPORT
page.content: Mr. Collins is 80 years old and has lived in Stourport all his life.The shops in Stourport during the war didn't have a lot of things.He had to {queue}outside the butchers shop for 3 hours.He says that there have been many changes during the past 20 years. He mainly shops in town occasionally visiting Worcester.Conditions were worse during the{first war}than the second war.He{started work at 13}and had to walk to Kidderminster to work in a{mill.}He remembers whilst at school writing in a{tray of sand}with his finger and the subjects studied were very limited.The power station was built in the 1920's and brought a lot of employment.(This power station was closed in the Spring of 1985)
